summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Comcast Communications LLC, demanding telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felony violations including conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction of justice, and includes a request for confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and signed the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Comcast must produce records or appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan.

events.title: Start Date for Records Request
events.description: The beginning date for the telephone records being subpoenaed from Comcast.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Comcast on August 13, 2019, seeking extensive telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward.
The investigation involves suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (obstruction of justice).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Comcast voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena demands subscriber information, billing details, call records, text message logs, and device identifiers for the specified telephone numbers.
The document indicates an active federal grand jury investigation was ongoing in the Southern District of New York in August 2019.
